title: Wayne Rooney breaks social media silence after Coleen's row with Rebekah Vardy

Wayne Rooney has broken his social media silence following his wife Coleen's infamous spat with fellow WAG Rebekah Vardy.

The professional footballer, who turned 34 on Thursday, used his birthday celebrations as his reason for returning to social media.

Liverpool native Wayne shared a snap of himself alongside three of his four sons - Kit, three, Klay, six, and nine-year-old Kai - who he shares with Coleen, 33, onto his Twitter and Instagram account.

The couples youngest child 20-month-old Cass was not in the image.

He wrote alongside the adorable picture, that saw him beaming beneath a grey cap: "Thanks for the birthday wishes everyone. Enjoying it with my boys."

Coleen also paid tribute to her childhood sweetheart on his special day by posting a picture of him with their brood.

(Image: AFP/Getty Images)

She penned a sweet caption, that read: "Happy Birthday @wayenrooney... have a brilliant day with our boys!! All our love always xxx."

It comes after Coleen accused Rebekah Vardy's Instagram account of leaking stories to a British tabloid.

(Image: Twitter)

(Image: DIGITAL/EROTEME.CO.UK)

In the epic takedown that nearly broke the internet, the nation watched in shock as Coleen exposed Rebekah's account and told her followers she became suspicious when stories were getting published about her that only her select followers could know about.

Coleen explained how she blocked all users apart from Vardy's account from seeing her social media stories, then purposely posted false information to see if it ended up in the press.

(Image: Getty Images)

Vardy, 37, who is pregnant with her fifth child, has vehemently denied all allegations and hired a cyber security expert to clear her name.

Pregnant WAG Rebeka has gained 49,000 new followers in the wake of what has branded as the WAGatha Christie scandal.
description: The footballer has returned to social media following his wife's infamous spat with fellow WAG Rebekah Vardy
